intro: Mohria achilleifolia, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, typically blooming in late summer. Mohria achilleifolia is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
